intro: Achillea erba-rotta subsp. erba-rotta, commonly known as the lesser yarrow, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of silver-gray, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces flat, composite flower heads in shades of white, pink, or red, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a popular choice for gardens and herbal use.
